social_posts.post_text:
A few of our favorite Christmas reads! Originally, I’d wrap 25 books for advent each Christmas. That got a little tiring, so now I put them in a basket next to our fireplace. Sometimes I read them aloud to my younger kids. Other times I find the kids curled up on the couch reading one of their favorites. Of all the 25+ Christmas books we have, these are our favorites. 

I threw in a shout out to my amazing and talented assistant @christenkrumm who wrote It Happened at Christmas! It’s a fun read for your teen (YA romantic comedy).

Find more of our family favorites for Christmas and the whole year at my Amazon Shop! 

🛒Amazon.com/shop/kristiclover (the link is in my bio @kristiclover )

I know I’ve been quiet for a time. I needed time to process and grieve the loss of my dad. I have appreciated all the prayers and encouragement from so many of you, especially after I shared that I was with my dad at hospice. 

It’s been a long six months. I’ve experienced a roller coaster of emotions as I juggled caring for my dad as his health failed — and sorting out his finances. At times it felt like a full time job. 

Dealing with old pain and hurt, learning how to forgive, allowing God’s love to pour out of me in ways I never knew was possible was an amazing example of how God works all things together for the good of those who love Him. I had penned up bitterness and anger from a lifetime of “issues”, many centering around a sense of abandonment and rejection from my dad. Yet, God is good and gave me a love and tender heart for my dad over the past couple years. 

A little background info for those who don’t know that I went through a season of depression and complete burn out shortly following my book launch (which was quickly followed by all the lockdown stress). Through the tough months of counseling, I allowed God to dig into the past pains that I had buried. At times it was so overwhelming I couldn’t imagine why I needed to keep working through old stuff. I was so good at stuffing problems and just smiling and moving on. (What was so wrong with that?🤣) 

I was literally a hoarder of emotions and pain. I’d laugh with my counselor that I’d written a book about organizing and decluttering and now I was working on decluttering my “mental mess” (thank you Dr. Caroline Leaf for that great phrase).

While I was doing the hard work of working through my junk, the Lord brought a life-changing program called Skills into Steve and my life. More on that soon! All I can say is that God is so faithful and so good.

Being with my dad for the final week of his life was an honor. It was a blessing to care for him and love on him as he slipped from his life on earth to the presence of our Savior. Yep, my dad recommitted his life to the Lord shortly before he died…

(Continued in the comments ⬇️)

What a happy Mother’s Day it was! Having all my kids together is a gift I treasure more than ever before now that I have two adult kids and a new daughter-in-law. Thank you sweet family for making this mom’s day so special!

#momtogether #homeschoolmomlife #happymothersday #momofadultkids

I’m back! I’m ready to share more encouragement for your home, homeschool, and mom life!! Think of me as your MOM mentor!! Let me know in the comments below what areas you need the most encouragement in these days?

I’m working on a new project that I’ll be sharing more about in the next few days. Can’t wait to share. 

Oh, and as for the interview I mention at the end here…it was with @jillsimonian with @prageru @pragerukids We talked about How to Start Homeschooling! For those who have followed me from the start, can you believe that I’ve already graduated two kids out of our homeschool??!!

#yourmommentor #masterorganizerofmayhem #homeschoolmom #comingbackstronger #familyfirst #momlife #onlineencourager

Happy Independence Day!!! Hurray for July 4, 1776!! What a precious gift our Lord has given to this nation — freedom!!

I love learning about how the Lord’s hand was so felt in the founding of our nation. So many godly (and flawed…like all of us) men and women sacrificed so much for us to become a nation — and remain a free nation. 

Praying for our country now!! Yet thankful that in Christ we have the ultimate freedom!! Isaiah 61:1-4 🙌🏻

Personal note: I almost didn’t post this. Not a flattering angle for me, but it’s real. My season of battling depression and then caring for my dad (see that post to understand some of the emotional toll that took) and being with him through hospice, and now going through a major healing process has taken a toll on my body. Raise your hand if you cope with pain and hurt with eating! 🙌🏻 Yep, that’s been one of my biggest coping mechanisms. I’ve been giving myself grace and learning how to rightly view myself as God’s beloved daughter. 

Reality is this is where I’m at. I’m at one of my highest weights again. It’s frustrating but what the Lord is teaching me is that He loves me right where I’m at. He sees me as His beautiful child whether I’m at my goal weight or overweight. Peeling back the layers of the lies I’ve believed for so many years has been so freeing. Freeing me to be okay with any judgemental thoughts that others might have as I post this photo. I know I’m His! I know I’m chosen, treasured, perfectly loved, completely understood, and fully known by my Heavenly Father!! What a praise!!

God bless you!! God bless America!!

@therelationshipresource #badlybrokendeeplyloved #yourmommentor #momlife #keepingitreal #weightlossjourney #getting #healthyinsideout #womensskills #workinprogress #godblessamerica

Join me live on Instagram tomorrow at 2:30pm PST on @let_them_breathe_ to talk about how to manage your back to school mayhem!! See you there!

#homeschoollife #homeschoolhacks #masterorganizerofmayhem #chaosconqueror #yourmommentor

We’re officially off to another homeschool year!! 🎉 We had a soft start last week. We typically start the day after Labor Day. However, this year we had the blessing of having friends come and stay with us. So, we decided to get half the work done last week and finish week one this week.

I’m hoping to finally get a few videos done for YouTube and walk you guys through all our favorite curriculum! 📚I have updated my Homeschooling page on my site. So, you can see the curriculum I’ve added for high school.

➡️ Find that at KristiClover.com/homeschooling (the link is in my bio)

Parents, did you know that @pragerukids offers more than our educational videos, books, and magazines? Visit PragerUkids.com or click the link in our story to be the first to hear when this full length interview with @jillsimonian and @kristiclover releases about How to Start Homeschooling. @pragerukids offers dozens of free parent resources to help you get more involved in your child’s education. 📚📖

JOIN ME TODAY at 12pm PST for my brand new M.O.M. MINDSET RESET Live training! Go to: KristiClover.com/mindset to register (and get the replay if you miss). This is the only time I’ll be sharing this training for free, so don’t miss out. 

As much as I’d love to say your next step is to pick your problem area, you won’t find long-term satisfaction with that. We truly have to dig into the reasons we accumulate “stuff” - clutter is a symptom of something deeper. Oh, we’ll get to how to get rid of the clutter, but we first have to learn how to declutter our minds. Sounds crazy, but I guarantee that this is the key to your organizing that you may not have implemented before.

So, please join me today!

#masterorganizerofmayhem #momlife #mommindsetreset #yourmommentor

Merry Christmas! This has been a crazy year in so many ways. Losing my dad in March and then closing the year out with major abdominal surgery are two low lights. Family trips to Texas, Hawaii, and Utah, starting a membership the Lord put on my heart years ago, and experiencing love and support from my family, friends, and our church body have been some of the highlights!! 🙌🏻 

I feel like the Lord really showed me His love, faithfulness, and goodness in new ways this year. From struggling to understand why He was allowing certain trials in my life and battling to come to terms with pain from my past, I can say that He loves me well! He so personally walked me through some really hard moments and demonstrated “how wide and long and high and deep is the love of Christ, and to know this love that surpasses knowledge—that [I was] filled to the measure of all the fullness of God.” Eph. 3:17-19

Praying the Lord reveals Himself in new ways as you reflect on this year. I’m so excited and hopeful for 2024! 

Fun behind-the-scenes detail about this year’s family photo: We took this a couple days before my surgery and forgot to take one picture without my son’s sweet girlfriend. So, she made the card front and center this year. So before you ask if they’re engaged, nope…but we adore her. 

📸: blakecloverphoto
#merrychristmas #familyphotos #godisgood #yourmommentor
